definition: to emerge as a new force to be reckoned with (idiom)
different/other/hetero-/unusual/strange/surprising/to distinguish/to separate/to discriminate
(bound form) army/military
to dash/to move forward quickly/to bulge/to protrude/to break through/to rush out/sudden/Taiwan pr. [tu2]

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: Development of Chinese literature to the late Ming novels have sprung up everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 中国文学发展到晚明时期，小说创作异军突起。

sentences.english: In recent years, the sudden emergence of affordable products in the Korean market.
sentences.chinese: 近年来，中低档产品在韩国市场异军突起。

sentences.english: Among lots of regionally flavor restaurants in Beijing, the Xiangcai restaurant also expand rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 在北京各种地方风味餐馆中，湘菜馆也可谓异军突起。

sentences.english: To solve this problem, guarantee companies rise.
sentences.chinese: 为解决这一问题，担保公司异军突起。

sentences.english: In chapter two, the evidences and the influences of the European ultra-rightist parties' sudden rise are mentioned.
sentences.chinese: 第二章欧洲极右翼政党异军突起的主要表现和影响。

sentences.english: The boom about the folk institution of age service gives us new idea.
sentences.chinese: 民间养老服务机构的异军突起为我们提供了新的思路。

sentences.english: In chapter three, the subjective and objective reasons of the European ultra-rightist parties' sudden rise are discussed.
sentences.chinese: 第三章欧洲极右翼政党异军突起的主客观原因。

definition: to rise abruptly (to a towering position)/to tower over/to spring up/to emerge suddenly/the emergence (e.g. of a power)
lit. only one branch of the tree is thriving (idiom)/fig. to be in a league of one's own/outstanding
most outstanding/par excellence
lit. late-comer lives above (idiom); the up-and-coming youngster outstrips the older generation/the pupil surpasses the master
to reveal outstanding talent (idiom); to stand out as conspicuously brilliant
an up-and-coming youngster/new talent/a brilliant younger generation
nouveau riche/upstart/new appointee

to come first in triennial palace examinations (idiom, refers to the carved stone turtle head in front of the imperial palace, next to which the most successful candidate in the imperial examinations was entitled to stand)/to be the champion/to be the very best in any field
first sign of budding talent/to display one's ability for the first time
to rise/to spring up/to burgeon/to be aroused/to come into vogue
dark horse/fig. unexpected winner
to shine (of talents, skills, accomplishment)/to demonstrate extraordinary talent or skill
to advance singing loudly (idiom); triumphant progress
current favorite/the latest thing/darling (of the market or the media etc)
flourishing and still in the ascendant (idiom); rapidly expanding/still growing strong/on the up
to amaze the world with a single brilliant feat (idiom); an overnight celebrity
